faqs.title: FAQ
faqs.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.faq1_answer: Coliving is a modern and responsible way of living together. It meets the flexibility, comfort and conviviality needs of young professionals. At The Good Spot, we carefully select houses, all equipped with an outdoor space and designed for harmonious shared living. Each resident has their private space (bedroom + bathroom), while the living areas are shared. The monthly rent includes everything: utilities, cleaning, services, electricity, internet... Nothing to manage, we take care of everything!
faqs.faq2_answer: All our houses are located in the near suburbs of Paris.
faqs.faq3_question: Is there a minimum rental period?
faqs.faq3_answer: There is no legal minimum duration. However, we ask candidates to plan for at least six months to ensure good harmony in the house. If needed, you can leave earlier by giving one month's notice.
faqs.faq4_question: How many people live in a Coliving?
faqs.faq4_answer: Our houses accommodate between 6 and 12 residents, depending on the number of available bedrooms.
faqs.faq5_question: Does a house need to be fully occupied to operate?
faqs.faq5_answer: No, a house can operate even if not all rooms are occupied.
faqs.faq6_question: What is included in my rent?
faq6_answer_list: Free access to all common spaces: kitchen, living room, dining room, laundry room, outdoor space
faqs.faq7_question: Do I have to pay the occupancy tax?
faqs.faq7_answer: Yes, as in any conventional housing. It is calculated pro rata to the time spent in the house.
faqs.faq8_question: What type of lease do I sign?
faqs.faq8_answer: A furnished lease, in accordance with French law n° 89‑462 of July 6, 1989.
faqs.faq9_question: Can I get CAF housing benefits?
faqs.faq9_answer: Yes. All our houses are eligible for housing assistance (APL, ALS), depending on your situation. Applications must be made directly on the CAF website.
faqs.faq10_answer: Rent is debited on the 5th of each month.
faqs.faq11_question: How do I join a house?
faq11_answer_list: After approval, you can quickly move into a house.
faqs.faq11_answer_note: Answers are usually given within 2 to 3 working days.
faqs.faq12_question: What documents are required to book?
faq12_answer_list: Proof of occupation (pay slips, employment contract, business registration, student certificate, etc.)
faqs.faq12_answer_note: Depending on the situation, a guarantor may be required. Documents are uploaded to the online platform.
faqs.faq13_answer: A Coliver is a house ambassador. They help with co-optation, participate in visits, and can be a contact in case of difficulty.
faqs.faq14_question: How can I become a Coliver?
faqs.faq14_answer: Colivers are selected by The Good Spot teams. When a Coliver leaves the house, a volunteer resident can take over the role.
faqs.faq15_question: Can a couple rent a room?
faqs.faq15_answer: No. Rooms are strictly individual, one person per room.
faqs.faq16_answer: No, for comfort, safety and hygiene reasons.
faqs.faq18_answer: No. Age is not a criterion. The average age is around 30, with residents ranging from 18 to 55.
faqs.faq19_question: Can I apply even without immediate availability?
faqs.faq19_answer: Yes. You will be placed on a waiting list.
faqs.faq20_question: Is it possible to visit a property?
faqs.faq20_answer: Yes. Virtual tours are offered to discover the properties remotely.
faqs.faq21_question: What amenities are in the houses?
faq21_answer_list: A comfortable living and dining room
faqs.faq22_answer: No, but a linen kit can be purchased upon booking and delivered on arrival.
faqs.faq23_answer: Yes: cleaning of common areas is done once a week. Dishes and garbage management remain the responsibility of residents. No cleaning is done in private spaces.
faqs.faq24_question: Can I bring my own furniture?
faqs.faq24_answer: The bedroom is already fully furnished, but you can add some personal decorative items.
faqs.faq26_answer: Yes, your bedroom is your private space.
faqs.faq27_question: How is life in the coliving organized?
faqs.faq27_answer: Each resident has their private space, while common areas are shared with respect, communication and conviviality.
faqs.faq28_question: Can I book two rooms with a friend?
faqs.faq28_answer: Yes, if rooms are available. We recommend submitting both applications at the same time.
faqs.faq29_question: Can two people occupy one room?
faqs.faq30_question: What is the processing time for an application?
faqs.faq30_answer: Between 24 and 72 hours, once the application is complete.
faqs.faq31_question: Can I declare the accommodation as my main residence?
faqs.faq31_answer: Yes, you can declare your accommodation as your main residence.
faqs.faq32_question: What does the insurance included in my rent cover?
faqs.faq32_answer:
It covers:
- your private bedroom,
- the common areas.
It does not cover:
- your personal belongings,
- your civil liability.
faqs.faq33_question: When do I need a guarantor?
faqs.faq33_answer_intro: A guarantor may be required in case of insufficient or irregular income:
faqs.faq34_question: What types of guarantors are accepted?
faqs.faq35_answer: Yes, if the desired accommodation is not available.
faqs.faq36_question: What criteria determine priority on the waiting list?
faqs.faq37_question: Can I set an end date for the contract?
faqs.faq37_answer: No. However, you can give notice as soon as you arrive if your departure date is known.
faqs.faq38_question: Can I cancel or modify a reservation?
faq38_answer_list: Before signing: free modification without fees.
After signing, before lease start: modification possible, possible fees.
After lease start: contract conditions apply.
faqs.faq40_question: How do I receive mail or packages?
faqs.faq40_answer: Each house has a shared mailbox. Remember to indicate the accommodation number to ensure proper delivery.
